intro: Patabea capitellata, commonly known as the mountain patabea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters at the top of the plant. Due to its specialized habitat, Patabea capitellata is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
